IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: The organization is a New York not-for-profit corporation, dedicated to promoting running, walking, and other physical activities for the benefit of persons of all ages and abilities, enhancing health and fitness for all and responding to a variety of community needs.
IRS990.MissionDescription: New York Road Runners is dedicated to promoting the sport of distance running, enhancing health and fitness for all, and responding to community needs. Our road races and other fitness programs draw upwards of 300,000 runners annually.
IRS990.Description: Marathon, General/Other:In fiscal year 2010, New York Road Runners (NYRR) had over 100,000 persons apply to run in the ING NYC Marathon. NYRR had 43,866 participants cross the finish line. NYRR also had over 2,000,000 spectators on the course as well as a worldwide television audience. THIS MASS-PARTICIPANTS AND WIDELY-VIEWED ANNUAL EVENT ALLOWS AND INSPIRES PERSONS OF ALL AGES AND ABILITIES TO ADOPT AN ACTIVE AND HEALTHY LIFESTYLE THROUGH RUNNING, WALKING, AND RELATED FITNESS ACTIVITIES.

Activity2.Description: Other Races and Programs, General/Other: In fiscal year 2010, New York Road Runners (NYRR) had over 370,000 participants sign up to run in 52 weekly events, 13 kid races, & 5 walks. NYRR had over 270,000 finishers. WEEKLY RACES AND OTHER RUNNING AND WALKING EVENTS PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR PERSONS OF ALL AGES AND ABILITIES. INCLUDING CHILDREN AND DISABLED INDIVIDUALS TO PARTICIPATE IN REGULAR EXERCISE ACTIVITIES, THEREBY PROMOTING AN ACTIVE AND HEALTHY LIFESTYLE.

Activity3.Description: Youth Services, General/Other:NYRR's Youth Programs division organizes and supports various running-based programs at schools, community centers and other locations in low-income areas in order to engage children in physical fitness activities to improve their health, combat obesity and build character.

ActivityOther.Description: other program services includes Publication and Classes, Merchandising and management reimbursement and other.

Form990ScheduleCPartIV.Explanation: Malkin & Ross lobbyed on NYRR behalf to solicit funding from city and state officials.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: Management is not aware of any violation of its tax status as an organization exempt from income taxes, nor of any exposure to unrelated business income tax. The NYRR is no longer subject to audits by applicable taxing jurisdictions for the periods prior to 2006.

Form990ScheduleFPartIV.Explanation: Schedule F, Part I, Line 2: NYRR requires grantee to submit monthly reports on its programs participants and developments consult with regard to proposed changes in programs, and obtain prior approval for certain changes.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: NYRR Youth Programs requires a post-Grant Status Report due within 6 months of the grant award payment. The report includes a description of the grantee's activities during the past six months and how the funds were spent.

Form990ScheduleLPartIV.Relationship: several directors of NYRR serve on the Foundation's governing board
Form990ScheduleLPartIV.DescriptionOfTransaction: Dr. Norbert Sander, Mary Wittenberg, Allan Steinfeld and Bryant McBride also serve as Directors on The Armory Foundation's board. Mike Frankfurt serves as Chairman for The Armory Foundation.The Armory Foundation provides the venue for several NYRR events.

Form990ScheduleLPartIV.Relationship: mary wittenberg serves on the board of world marathon majors, llc
Form990ScheduleLPartIV.DescriptionOfTransaction: NYRR is a member of World Marathon Major which seek to raise interest in marathoning.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 2
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Norbert Sanders, Board Director and Mary Wittenberg, President and Board Member of NYRR both serve on Board of Directors of The Armory Foundation.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 6
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: New York Road Runners, Inc. has 58,993 members who participates in our events through the year.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Form 990 is completed by Finance, then it is provided to our legal team, and then a copy is provided to our outside accountant for review. Any comments and/or recommendations are reviewed and responded to by Finance. Each issue is documented and addressed until the return is finalized and approved for filing. A finalized copy is provided to the President and CEO of the organization. The board does not review the Form 990 before it is finalized but a hardcopy is provided at the Board Meeting held in March after the last deadline of the Form 990.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Annual affirmation by director, officers and members of Sr. Management of reading, understanding and compliance with written policy, signing of declaration affirming adherence to policy, completion of questionnaire, required filing of amended questionnaire in event of change in circumstance between annual reports, and regular Board monitoring of foregoing, review and determination of existance of conflicts made by the Executive Committee and Counsel, person with conflict excused from deliberations and decisions.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: (a) Comparability data collected by HR Director presented to Compensation Committee of Board of Directors which reviews data, CEO's written self-evaluation, and year's performance and makes recommendation to full Board which, in absence of CEO, reviews performance and makes final determination of CEO's compensation, as reflected in minutes. (b) Comparability data collection by HR Director, and his compensation recommendations based on supervisors' evaluations, presented to CEO, who makes overall compensation recommendation to Compensation Committee of Board of Directors which, after review, makes recommendation to full Board which makes final determination of overall compensation levels, as reflected in minutes, persons receiving compensation not involved in review or determination process.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Consistent with its obligation under applicable law, rules, and regulations, as applicable, NYRR makes documents such as its application for tax exemption, annual information returns, conflict of interest policy, and governing documents, available through public filings and/or on written request.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: audit oversight and selection of an independent accountant:
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The joint Finance/Audit Committee of the Board has the fiduciary responsibility for hiring of the audit firm, the review of the risk issues for the organization and the final audit review and package that is accepted by the Board. The Committee meets with the audit firm independently from staff during the audit review process and recommends to the Board the acceptance of the Audit and its findings. This process has not changed from the prior year.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PAGE 1, BOX B: REASON FOR AMENDED RETURN
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: New York Road Runners, Inc. is filing an amended 2009 Federal Form 990 in order to update certain narratives and responses to Part VI of the form, and correct certain typographical errors.
